skillTree.localised_description: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Lustria, tempted from their tropical jungles to bear the Lizardmen to battle.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Unrelenting Hunters", while this Mount is equipped, for Cold One rider units
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: "Unrelenting Hunters" for Cold One rider units
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Very rare and virtually extinct, even in Lustria, the Horned One's preternatural swiftness puts it way ahead of other Cold Ones.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Unrelenting Hunters", while this Mount is equipped, for Cold One rider units
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: "Unrelenting Hunters" for Cold One rider units
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Grymloq is Kroq-Gar's ageless Carnosaur, upon which the great Lizardman Lord has won all his many victories.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Orders must be followed and the chain of command honoured; only then will the Great Plan be served.
Lizardmen can move with deceptive speed and agility when they have to.
Across the gulf of space, the serene Potec has shared the secrets of time so that the Lizardmen may protect themselves against supernatural attack.
The City of Destiny withstood the Ancient Enemy's infernal onslaught for centuries; subsequent spawnings have magical resistance to physical attack.
Those Saurus not lost to war may live to a great age - their long service esteemed and respected by younger Lizardmen hungry for experience.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Saurus and Cold One units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Temple Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The relentlessly-bloodthirsty Children of Chaos do not deserve a place in the Old Ones' perfect world.

effects.description: Melee attack: +15 when fighting against Beastmen

Leadership: +6 when fighting against Beastmen
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% when fighting against Beastmen
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The insidious Rat-spawn, who dare threaten Lustria's temple-cities with their vile plagues, must be wiped from its hallowed shores.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The vicious cruelty of the Druchii has no place within the Great Plan and must be stamped out at all costs.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Dark Elves

Leadership: +6 when fighting against Dark Elves
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Dark Elves
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Resolutely not part of the Great Plan, the disgusting Greenskins are a stain on the surface of the world.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The self-serving, insular Dawi must all be killed if balance is to be restored to the world.

effects.description: Melee attack: +20 when fighting against Dwarfs

Leadership: +6 when fighting against Dwarfs
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Dwarfs
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Once before, the Ancient Enemy unmade the Great Plan. It shall not be permitted to do so again.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The dead should dead remain, never to rise again and trouble the living.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

Leadership: +6 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mankind has developed in a direction not in keeping with the tenets of the Great Plan; they must be stopped.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Whilst one brother lives in darkness, the other, his double-twin, exists in light. Behold!"

effects.description:
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "By your scales be you blessed by the divine protector."

effects.description:
Upkeep: -20% for Saurus Infantry and Temple Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Brother of Great Tlazcotl, Tepok of the Air shall always be honoured. Let it be done."

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Cousin of darkness, Huanchi's priests too shall dwell in twilight."
"The universe resides within his reflective eyes; embrace the coldness of blessed certainty."
"Creator-meld of the beast, Itzl be praised!"

effects.description:
Upkeep: -20% for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Packs, Cold One, Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Stegadon, Bastiladon, Terradon & Carnosaur units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Of course, those who live to kill must also kill to live...
The Plan *will* be observed, even if every member of the younger races has to die to achieve the Old Ones' goals.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Skaven
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A long-serving member of an ancient, honourable tradition.

skillTree.localised_description: This seasoned warrior understands irregular combat perfectly: when to attack, when to hold back, when to withdraw behind heavier lines.

skillTree.localised_description: The unforgiving law of the jungle is most clear on matters of ascendancy.

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Saurus and Temple Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Saurus and Temple Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Braves who emerge from the same spawning often share a deep connection – a bond which provides considerable advantages in battle.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mount and rider, together as one at their very cores. Indivisible.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You need to be at the very centre of this pack of furious monsters to have the minutest chance of controlling their rage. Good luck!

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ancient Salamander, Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon and Dread Saurian units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Ancient Salamander, Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon and Dread Saurian units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ancient Salamander, Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon and Dread Saurian units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The power generated by the overarching Geomantic Web can also be used to nourish the Saurus on the march.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Life in the jungle means knowing the difference between which flora can heal and what, if ingested, will kill you.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

factionEffects.localised_description: Kroq-Gar is an ancient Saurus, the last remaining warrior from the now ruined temple-city of Xhotl. The spawning that brought him into the world also produced a handful of other Saurus, each marked for greatness.

effects.description: Upkeep: -8% for armies led by Saurus Oldbloods
Saurus buildings grant additional bonuses to Saurus Scar-Veterans and Saurus Oldbloods
Weapon strength: +1% per character rank for Saurus Scar-Veterans and Saurus Oldbloods
Experience gain: +30% for Saurus Scar-Veterans and Saurus Oldbloods

items.colour_text: An unspeakably powerful weapon once said to have been wielded by the warlike Old One deity, Tlanxla.

item_set.name: Ancient Energies
item_set.description: Some artefacts are imbued with the ancient energy of the Old Ones… as are some of their champions.

item_set.name: Ancient Energies
item_set.description: Some artefacts are imbued with the ancient energy of the Old Ones… as are some of their champions.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Hidden skill to grant Kroq'Gar's Saurus characters extra scaling
As the last remaining warrior of the now ruined temple-city of Xhotl, for Kroq-Gar the battle is not yet over.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -35% for Saurus and Cold One units
	(Lord's army)

Unit experience gain: +25% for Saurus Warriors and Cold One Rider units
	(Lord's army)
